definition: favor/to give charity to sb out of pity

sentences.english: How quickly their shrieks of pain turn to enraptured adulation.
sentences.chinese: 它们痛苦的尖叫迅速转变成对吾等恩赐的狂热谄媚。

sentences.english: The completeness of the Bible is as full as any other gifts of God.
sentences.chinese: 圣经的全备正如同上帝任何恩赐的全备。

sentences.english: Why do we possess this instinct, this gift?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我们会有这种本能，这种恩赐呢？

sentences.english: Now thanks be to God for his unspeakable gift!
sentences.chinese: 感谢神，因他有说不尽的恩赐。

sentences.english: Don't try to figure out your gifts before volunteering to serve somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 还未志愿投入服事已先，不要尝试想要找出你的恩赐。

sentences.english: There are no unspiritual abilities, just misused ones.
sentences.chinese: 从来没有不属灵的恩赐，只有被误用的恩赐。

sentences.english: There are no unspiritual abilities, just misused ones.
sentences.chinese: 从来没有不属灵的恩赐，只有被误用的恩赐。

sentences.english: But to each one of us grace has been given as Christ apportioned it.
sentences.chinese: 我们各人蒙恩，都是照基督所量给各人的恩赐。

sentences.english: That’s why it’s called the blessing of dimensionality.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我说的‘来自高维度的恩赐。

sentences.english: We’re to pass on to others God's many kinds of blessings.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们须将上帝的诸多恩赐传递给他人。

sentences.english: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 我们各人蒙恩，都是照基督所量给各人的恩赐。

sentences.english: Mother's Day is a long-held tradition of revering the woman who gives the gift of life.
sentences.chinese: 母亲节是一个长期奉行的敬女谁给生命的恩赐。

sentences.english: God has blessed me with so much, I thought.
sentences.chinese: 上帝已经给了我那么多恩赐，我自忖。

sentences.english: In fact the "indescribable gift" may allude to all these kinds ofthings.
sentences.chinese: 事实上“说不尽的恩赐”指的也许是所有这些事。

sentences.english: He told me that the treadle pump was a gift from God.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉我，脚踏泵真是上天的恩赐。

sentences.english: To count the blessings in life , believing abundance abounds.
sentences.chinese: 数念生命中的恩赐，相信富足无处不在。

definition: variant of 賜予|赐予[ci4 yu3]
special favor from a ruler/Emperor's generosity towards a favorite
favor from an emperor or high official
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
